project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the Sprint Report orders the list of completed issues by Key. It would be great if there was an option to instead order the completed issues by 'completion date/time'.

Often, I use the Sprint Report as a reference point during Product Increment Demonstrations - this goes much smoother when I can work through the list in order of issue completion, and thus demonstrate the evolution of a new features over the course of the Sprint.

The default ordering by Key in effect means the issues are ordered by the date added to the system, which I think is rarely a useful order for issues in this report.

Many thanks for considering this feature.
fields.summary: Provide option to order Sprint Report's 'Completed Issues' by completion date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As Emma, I want to be asked to create a branch from a toast notification if I've got Fusion configured, so that I don't have to go and create it manually later on.

Notes:
- this is part of Fusion and will be using Fusion's API

Questions:
- Does "toast notification" equal "AUI Message"?
- What does Fusion's API look like?
- Who decides what this looks like ultimately?
- How is this integrated into JIRA's workflow transitions?
- Where does the action take them?
- Is it possible to not take action?
- What actions in GreenHopper trigger this? Is this accessible if they dismiss it the first time?
fields.summary: Create a branch from toast notification

fields.description:
When there are many quick filters, the header area on the scrum board becomes unwieldy. This is especially a problem with scrum boards where you may need a different set of filters for planning than for work. 

Also, I frequently find myself creating multiple buttons for related ideas, e.g. separate filters for major+ vs. minor- priorities. If there were a way to define a quick filter that was a select box, that would clean things up a lot.
fields.summary: Need a better UI for boards with many Quick Filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Sometimes the cards take up too much space. I'd like the option in kanban & scrum/work modes to have skinnier cards like in scrum/planning mode. Ideally this would be togglable from the gear menu like the "expand/collapse swimlanes", but it could also be a board setting.
fields.summary: Skinny items in kanban/work views

Sprint ~ "SRWES" [all sprints related to release SRWES, having SRWES in the name]

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are another client looking for the functionality described here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/54487/aggregating-assigned-hours-for-team-members-in-a-sprint.

I know using hours isn't true Agile (as per this conversation https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/84349/rapid-board-time-estimates-with-sub-tasks) but it is something that would be extremely valuable for the majority of us that can't work in pure agile due to client commitments.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Showing assigned hours for team members in a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
can you please make planed sprints moveable? we do use "dummy sprints" to hold certain issues (like "to be analysed" for error tickets,..). when planing ahead with lots of sprints you 
a) don't know exactly how many sprints it will be
b) you have really much unused space in between your active and next sprint and the backlog

if we could move sprints I could just add new sprints when they are needed and drag them above the dummy sprints.

another way to improve this completely would be a way to "split" the backlog into user-defined sections where you can better groom your backlog. so we wouldn't have to create dummy sprints at all :)
fields.summary: As Agile User I want to drag planed sprints or have separators for my backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have a board for team A which includes a filter on a component "team a", this board has a working sprint which is showing in the sprint filters in work mode.

A sprint created by another team, "team b"  has a sub-task for team a, sub-task-1 and labelled "team a", the sub-task is part of a task, task-1. Task-1 is closed and sub-task-1 is closed (both resolved).

The sprint for Team B shows in the sprint filters for team A board - I wish it did not.

Task-1 shows as closed as mark of the work mode board of Team A. The "Move to Done" button shows also. When I click Move to Done I get the Update Parent Issue. Clicking this tells me it has been updated and I get a notification email. Nothing has changed however as the issue is already closed and the Move to Done button does not go away.
fields.summary: "Move to Done" button showing even though story closed

It will be nice if the user is given the option to configure what fields to be shown based on how important it is for the user. Some users would like to have other fields shown instead of the current default ones
.

It might be even more powerful to see look at the "version report" using a named filter or anonymous jql.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Right now, when you click Create Project in JIRA, you are presented with some templates for projects. Two of them are Agile: "Agile Scrum," and "Agile Kanban."

The user needs to make a decision whether they want Scrum or Kanban immediately, without much information to help them make their decision, and they also do not get the opportunity to include sample data.

We should combine "Agile Scrum" and "Agile Kanban" into one entry simply called "Agile" that the user can select, and when they click Next, it should take them to the first step of the new GreenHopper Create Board wizard where they have more information (soon videos) about Scrum vs. Kanban, and also the ability to use sample data.

We will also need to change some wording on the first step of the new Create Board wizard to include a mention about projects, since the user started this flow wanting to create a project, we don't want to confuse them by exclusively talking about boards.
fields.summary: Integrate JIRA's Create Project dialog with the new Create Board wizard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Flagging an issue does not work in JIRA Agile if Custom Field configuration is modified

h3. Steps to reproduce
- Edit 'Flagged' field and change the Field Searcher to 'None'
- Re-index

h3. Actual Results
- Flagging issues does not work

h3. Expected Results
- Flagging works as normal

Original description
{quote}From a user : "I tested the flagging feature and it worked nicely "out of the box".  I then customized the list of option values for the custom 'Flagged' field (changed wording on "Impediments" to "Impeded" and added "Priority") and re-indexed.  Now, I can add a flag in Plan mode through right-click but issues no longer display with the flag icon or the yellow color, and right-click options no longer display the "Remove Flag" option, only the "Add Flag option (although the flag has already been added)."

(see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+6.2.3+Release+Notes?focusedCommentId=373260654#comment-373260654)
{quote}
fields.summary: Flagging issue is broken when we change the values of field options

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1. Upgraded JIRA 5.2.6 to 6.0.2
2. Then installed Greenhopper 6.2.3 via Plugin Manager.

Noticed that the Epic issue type had been created as follows:

Name: gh.issue.epic
Description: gh.issue.epicdesc

The other Greenhopper types: Story, Improvement, etc, were created correctly.

Workaround: Edit the issue type and correct the Name and Description.  Problems will still exist with other strings such as gh.epic.label.name and gh.epic.label.desc, not sure yet how to work around these.

A previous installation of Greenhopper 6.2.2.2 on JIRA 5.2.6 (staging server) did not exhibit this problem.
fields.summary: The Epic issue type is installed with the wrong name and description

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Im using the Agile board to manage multiple teams issues and tasks and have setup many quick filters (for versions, users, etc) to allow filtering the content of the board to only what is important at that moment. Unfortunately this requires me to update/change the quick filters at least once a week as old version/users fall off and new ones are added.
The concept for this story is to allow a drop-down list of various items which the board recognizes based upon the board type and projects included:

Agile board dynamic quick filters for: AffectsVersion, FixVersion, User,  and optionally EpicName (includes all issues associated with that epic), StoryName (includes all issues associated with that story - sub issues or linked).
fields.summary: As a Manager I want GH to provide built in "Dynamic Fitlers" so I dont have to contstantly update the Quick Filters for Versions, Users, etc

fields.summary: Ability to export an Epic

fields.summary: Allow Deletion of Sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Seems there are additional issues with copying a board besides GHS-7633 and GHS-6850.  And, it's causing alot of troubleshooting time from my standpoint because I cannot turn this feature off - If I could, I certainly would because the new board is always corrupted.  

I find now that when a user is working with a new kanban board created from a copy of an existing kanban board, they have been unable to edit swimlanes.  They can get to all other features to configure/change, but they cannot remove nor change the existing swimlanes that were there from the original/source board. 

I've also found an issue when viewing the kanban board in configuration mode and viewing the columns, the number of issues associated with the filter for each column appear correctly; but, once you get out of configuration mode and return to view mode, the number of issues associated with each column are incorrect and they are always fewer or even zero. I've confirmed that no quick filters are enabled and can never get the correct issues to display. 

In each situation above, creating the same board from scratch and using all the same properties/filter results in the information being correct. 

It seems that there are some major data integrity/security issues when using the feature that many may not realize are there and are not working with correct data.  It doesn't look like the properties are all being cleared or set accordingly during this process.  

For me, this has been a real headache and huge loss of functionality and we use many, many boards and, from a training/rollout, it is much easier to start with an existing one that meets most of your needs.  But, I have to keep preaching to just not use the feature.  

Seems like this should be a higher priority than major given the integrity issues surrounding it.
fields.summary: Copying a board yields unexpected resutls for new board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the burndown report, if we have a quite few sprints in the board (something like 30 or more), it`s a pain to select one specific Sprint (in fact, it`s not possible, only if you use the down or up arrow in the keyboard and guess the Sprint).

We need a way to select the other Sprints in this list, since we can`t do this today.

It would be great if we can have something like a filter there, to show only recent sprints, or an auto-complete text box, then we can search the Sprint by the name.

Tested using Google Chrome, Firefox and IE.
fields.summary: Ability to filter the sprints in Burndown report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
- On a brand new JIRA instace (tested on 6.0.5); install Greenhopper (6.2.5)

h3. Expected Results
- Better handling of sample data generated

h3. This is affecting the following names and descriptions
- Custom Field names. 
- Issue Type names.
- Issue Type Scheme.

!issues.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround

If this is a fresh installation and contain no valuable data, we encourage to re-do the whole installation process with an empty database, follow the steps below:
# Uninstalled JIRA and clear the data
# Install JIRA and create a backup directly
# Install GreenHopper and Reindex
# Noticed that the problem still persist
# Perform a system restore with the backup data created earlier
# Double check that the problem is resolved after the restore
(i) Thank you [Matthew|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9193?focusedCommentId=498879&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-498879] for pointing this out

If the instance is being used for production:
# Unlock the GreenHopper Custom Fields as per our [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field] KB. This will enable them to be editable.
(!) Please lock them back after making the changes so as to prevent any accidental changes to the configuration, which can break GreenHopper.
# If there are duplicated Issue Type names (e.g.: "Story" and "gh.issue.story"):
## Bulk Edit the old Issue Types to the new ones as per our [Modifying Multiple ('Bulk') Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Modifying+Multiple+%28%27Bulk%27%29+Issues] docs. For example, if there is a "Story" Issue Type, move those issues to "gh.issue.story".
## Rename "Story" to "Story (unused)" and remove it from all the Issue Type schemes.
## Repeat these steps for any other duplicated Issue Types.
# Rename the Issue Types, Issue Type Scheme, Workflow Name, Workflow Scheme and Custom Fields through the browser to human-readable names (e.g.: rename the Issue Type "gh.issue.story" to "Story").
# Reindex JIRA, so as to update the indexes with the new names.
fields.summary: Custom Fields, Issue Types and Schemes appear incorrectly on a new install of Greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

Adding a toggle to show this could help this.

fields.description:
When planning releases ahead of time, but starting development a few weeks after populating the release, I would like to set the intercept of the trend line to the start date of development. 

Otherwise the development speed and projected end date is not properly reflects (e.g. I am always showing a pessimistic release date)
fields.summary: Version Report: Allow Intercept for development start

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When planning some sprints, adding issues on one rapid board changes planned sprints in other rapid boards. We should be able to plan several sprints without modifying other planned sprints on other rapid boards.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a project (DUMMY)
2. Create 5 issues in it
3. Create a scrum rapid board for that project (Roadmap 1)
4. Create 2 sprints (Sprint 1 and Sprint 2, don't start them)
5. In Sprint 1: add issue 1 & 2
6. In Sprint 2: add issue 3 & 4
7. Create another scrum rapid board for the same project (Roadmap 2)
8. Create 1 sprint (named Sprint 3, don't start it either)
9. In Sprint 3: add issue 5 & 2 (in that order)
10. Go back to the first rapid board (Roadmap 1)
Sprint 1 has changed and now contains issue 5, 2, 1 (in that order)

This is of course an undesired behaviour since planned sprints gets modified by different people. Planned sprints should only be changed when editing the rapid board to which they belong. Creating and editing sprints in one rapid boards should not modify planned sprints in other rapid boards.

Find below 3 attached screenshot illustrating the scenario described above.
fields.summary: Planned sprints changes planned sprints on other rapidboards

Thanks
Johannes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When trying to create a bug via a URL (or a HTML link), the Epic Link field is not filled, even though the URL contains a valid value for the custom field

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an Epic (take note of the Epic Name, as well as the ID of the Epic Link field)
# Try to create an issue using an URL, for example, like this (the ID of the custom field as well as value of the Epic Link will have to be tweaked accordingly) :
{code}
http://10.60.3.25:5210/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=10000&issuetype=2&priority=4&assignee=admin&reporter=admin&description=...&summary=test&customfield_10201=Books
{code}
# The Epic Link will be empty, while it is supposed to be filled :
!epic link URL.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* Even if I were to directly enter the issue key of the Epic into the URL (instead of the Epic Name), it would still not be filled
fields.summary: When creating issues via URL, the Epic Link is not filled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to be able to show only certain subtasks of a story in plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We use the quick filters to show only certain aspects (subtask types) of a story. At the moment the remaining effort is always based on all subtasks and does not consider the quick filter results.

We want the remaining effort of a story being based on the results of the quick filters.

The swim lanes already show the task count based on the quick filters ([^01-QuckFilterBasedRemainingTaskCount.png]). Why not add the remaining effort there ([^02-WhatWeNeed.png])?
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like the remaining effort of a story being based on quick filter results

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, there are no limits to the Story Points that the user can input. It's even possible for the user to input 1000 as the value of the Story Point. This can cause complications in the estimation and calculations.

Hence, it would be useful to be able to set a certain limit to the amount that a user can enter (for example, they can set the limit to be 100, so that's the highest Story Point they can input).
fields.summary: Ability to set limit of Story Points

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When creating an issue from an Epic, the 'Epic Link' field should be automatically filled with the epic from which the new issue is being created. However, this is not always the case

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create an Epic
# In the epic, open the 'create issue in epic' (the plus sign on the right of the 'Issues In Epic' part), in a new tab or new window :
!issuesinepic.png|thumbnail!
# Proceed with the issue creation menu, but take note of the Epic Link : It's not filled :
!epiclink2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* If the user clicks on the 'create issue in epic' button directly, the create new issue screen will pop-up, and the Epic Link will be automatically filled as expected :
!epiclink.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating issue in Epic doesn't always fill in the Epic Link

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When creating new sprint container it is always above the backlog container.
It is impossible to move the new container to other places ( for example to be the first container).

The workaround is to move user stories to the new container and rename it until The relevant container is empty - this is very annoying
fields.summary: New Sprint container is not moveable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Need the ability to select all past sprints to view velocity trend over longer times.
fields.summary: Make the number of past sprints displayed in the Velocity Chart configurable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today we cannot use sprint field for filtering.
It might be very useful to filter issues related to specific sprints from the past or to see all sprints.
fields.summary: Add ability to filter issues that are/were related to sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When we have an issue in the Done status (Closed) with any sub-tasks in the Open status, this issue doesn`t appear in the backlog, on the Plan Mode.

It would be great if we can have an option in GreenHopper to show those issues in the backlog, so we can plan a Sprint with the sub-tasks.

This will also need to allow an user to close a Sprint with issues in the Done status but with opened sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Ability to view Done issues with open sub-tasks in the backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As as a Project Manager, I find it very difficult/impossible to use the Agile boards to see ALL work on a particular team members plate for the current sprint. This is essential for managing a project. 

The issues is that it is either not possible, not easy, or not documented, how to view owner level summaries in the boards.   There is an option to "View in Issue Navigator" but this leaves out subtasks which means again, there is no way to see ALL work for a particular team member for the current sprint.

This is partially related to the fact that subtasks are treated as second class citizens and don't appear in the Plan, or Report board and other areas. (Please, please, change that!)
fields.summary: Display summary of all issues/sorypoints (including subtasks) by owner for a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,
My name is Michal and I am leading the Agile process in Liveperson. We are using Jira and Greenhopper successfully few years now.

I have an enhancement request:
I would like to be able to choose if I want to see # of issues or total T-shirt/points in the reports.
For example - the CFD is only about # of issues but the velocity chart is only about T-shirt/points.
I would like to be able to choose the appropriate view in each report.
In other reports like the sprint report, I get sum of t-shirt/points but not sum of stories.
fields.summary: Reporting Enhancement

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I choose the Epic Report, which defaulted to a certain epic in the project.  I click on the Epic dropdown to choose a single epic.  A list is shown that fills the screen from top to bottom, without the ability to scroll the list.

I can pick one of the epics showing, which are not in ranked order, and the report will show just that epic.

I have no way to pick any of the epics that are off the screen at the top or the bottom.  And the report continues to default to whatever epic I picked last, so I am stuck only being able to report on a handful of the epics that exist in the project.

Please allow the list to be scrollable so I can pick any epic.
fields.summary: Long epic list in Epic Report unscrollable

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-9167].
  {panel}

As a Greenhopper Scrum product owner, I want story estimates to automatically total to the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks IF and ONLY IF subtasks are entered (else I want story estimates to be manual entry) so that I can view on the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining time.

Definition of Done:
1)  When no sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story allows entry of a value manually
2)  When one or more sub-tasks exist for a story, the estimate field for the story is calculated as the sum of the estimates for all sub-tasks for that story

Context:

I'm finding a feature in Greenhopper to NOT operate as I would have expected. The feature is in estimating where the estimation on the scrum board is configured for original time estimates. What I would like is: 
1) when no sub-tasks are created for a story, the estimation and remaining fields are editable within the story 
2) when sub-tasks have been created, the story estimate and remaining fields are calculated as the sum of the estimate and remaining fields for the sub-tasks 

What's currently happening is that the story estimate field is not calculated from the sum of the sub-tasks but the story remaining field is. Worse, if you enter a value in the story estimate field when sub-tasks have been added and estimated, the value entered into the story estimate field is added to the story remaining field, which already has the sum of the sub-tasks. Thus, if, as a work around, you try to manually enter a story estimate that equals the sum of the sub-task estimates, the story remaining field value doubles. There's no work around for this. This feature seems poorly defined. I understand what the product team was trying to accomplish... the ability to estimate and view remaining values for stories that have no sub-tasks or prior to sub-tasks being added. What they missed is that the field could serve both functions - manual entry when no sub-tasks exist and calculated value when sub-tasks do exist. I strongly urge the product team to consider this feature at their earliest opportunity as the inability to see from the scrum board the original estimate against the remaining value in plan and work mode is a problem. 

h5. Steps to reproduce
# Configure Scrum board to use "Original Time Estimate" for Estimation Statistic
# Configure Scrum board to use "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" for Time Tracking
# Create an issue with issue type Story, without specifying any Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate
# Create 2 sub-tasks for this issue.
#* Sub-task 1 has Remaining Estimate of 4 hours
#* Sub-task 2 has Remaining Estimate of 2 hours
# Checking parent of sub-tasks in Issue View, Original Estimate and Remaining Estimate is now shown as 6 hours
# Navigate back to Scrum board, open Issue Detail View, and Original Estimate for parent issue is _Unestimated_
fields.summary: Provide ability to automatically sum estimates from sub-tasks in user stories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have three teams, all working from the same backlog.  I've created three seperate boards, each with a unique name and a seperate filter.  Each of these filters are essentially the same filter, just saved separately, e.g.

{code}
project = "<project name>" and component = AAA ORDER BY cf[10400] ASC
{code}

Unfortunately, if you begin a sprint on one board, that sprint is the 'active' for the other two boards.  This means that one cannot start a sprint.  This is a big problem. 

Interestingly, one can create a new sprint, and that unstarted sprint is _only_ visible within the appropriate board.  However, the "start sprint" action is unavailable untll the active sprint is completed.

The only work around I can currently see is to mark the stories with a variable label - e.g. team1, team2, and team3 - and define the filters appropriately, 

I consider that the board should be the defining factor in sprint ownership and not the exact text of its unique filter.  Might someone explain this one to me?
fields.summary: Different RapidBoards show same sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have configured our agile boards to do estimation statistics on "Original Time Estimate" and Time tracking on "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent".

Unfortunately the planning screen does not show hours summarized also from sub-tasks. If you do planning (Plan screen) only on sub-task level than the field for estimate (total estimate time) is blank. See attached screenshot. 
Also problem here is that if you do not resolve task/sub-task in eg: Sprint 1 and you put it into Sprint 2 it will show original estimate (the one that's done on task level) instead of remaining time.
The same applies to Report screen - Burndown chart. The sum of remaining hours for sub-task hours is not there. Original estimate is used instead.
fields.summary: Sub-task hours estimate not reflected in planning and reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ensure that automated tests around future sprints/plan mode are functioning

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to edit the name of closed sprints, currently it is only possible to edit the name of active sprints.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to edit the name of a closed Sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As per [this issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5903] I see that we earlier mentioned that users can use drag/drop to move issues out of an active sprint.
bq. Click Plan, then drag the issue out of the planned sprint and into another sprint or into the backlog.


However, this was not working so we fixed it in the documentation. 
As a user this would be the most intuitive way to do it. Currently there are no hints as to why a user is not able to drag drop an issue out of the sprint in the Plan mode. We should fix that.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Add drag drop functionality to Remove an issue from active sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce the issue from scratch: 
# Install a fresh JIRA instance and install the Greenhopper plugin. 
# Create two new Epic tickets (TESTFIRST-1 with Epic label 01 and TESTFIRST-2 with Epic label 02) with the "create issue" (link or button) on the JIRA dashboard.
# Lock JIRA and reindex.
# Try to create new issue with the "create issue" (link or button) on the JIRA dashboard, and open the Epic link drop down menu. It appeared that the Epic label is mismatch with the Epic ticket
!Screen Shot 2013-08-05 at 1.20.51 PM.png!

*PS: the issue is not reproduced if the first Epic is created via the scrum board of JIRA.*

Workaround:
# If you start typing a string, the suggested list will be corrected
# Use GreenHopper's planning board to assign Epics
fields.summary: Incorrect suggestion on the Epic link field on the issue creation screen

fields.description:
Currently, in GreenHopper board, if there is a child issue for a parent Epic issue, and this child issue is cloned to another issue,  The latter one does not have any link to the parent Epic issue.

It will be nice if it's possible to have a link between the cloned issue and the parent Epic issue.
fields.summary: Link issues cloned to child issues of an Epic issue type to the parent Epic.

We have a workaround which involves zooming out to 75%, but that makes all the tickets extremely small.  My users are very annoyed by this.  Thank you.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I am using Jira + Atlassian plugin in the past 2 years and I am very happy with the production.

I have a feature suggestion:
add counter to each user story (in work screen) that count down the days from the moment user story is in progress. for example user story with 4 user story point will show the number 4 when it start to be in progress in the next day 3 and so own.

I think it will give a view to the team how much they spend on the user story against their estimation
fields.summary: Add Count down to user story

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The [GreenHopper 6.2 documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Configuring+Estimation+and+Tracking] says:

 {quote} A common approach is to estimate tasks in Story Points, then track tasks using hours. {quote} 

Since one estimates in story points it is also common to see the story points burndown and also track the remaining time. 

To see both the story points burndown and also the remaining time one has to toggle the tracking statistic between none and Remaining Estimate and Time Spent. 

Prior to GH 6 one could have a burndown chart of the story points left and also the time left. Please can this functionality be re-added.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to change estimation statistics for the Sprint burndown independently from the board configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, if customer has a pre-defined fixed version (example: version test) and on the GreenHopper Kanban board. If the customer would want to release the issue associated with this pre-defined fixed version, it returns error as the screenshot below:

!release.png!

Kanban board default filter:
{noformat}
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{noformat}

It should enable the customer to release for unreleased version as well.

Quote from customer:
{quote}Therefor issues with an unreleased fix version (because this field is used for planning purpose) will appear on the board but cannot be released!{quote}

*Steps to Replicate*
# Create a Kanban Board associated with Project
# Create a version on the project, no release date defined
# Perform edit on the issues to plan fixing the issue on the newly created version
# Move all the issues planned to the done column
# Release and insert the version as planned earlier
# Noticed error message
fields.summary: Kanban Release for a Planned Fixed Version

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In GreenHopper 6.2.2.2, GreenHopper allows users to end sprints, even when the sprint's *end date* is set *before the start date*. 

The warning message:
{noformat}
The start date of a sprint must be before the end date.
{noformat}
still shows up in the Complete Sprint window, as in this screenshot: [^Sprint.jpg]. 
But I am still able to click on the *Complete Sprint..* button, and go through with the process and complete the sprint. Here is the screenshot of the dates in the sprint report: [^SprintReport.jpg]

Tested with GreenHopper *6.2.2* and *6.2.2.2*, installed with *JIRA 6.0.1*.

Steps to reproduce:
# Install JIRA 6.0.1 and GreenHopper 6.2.2.2
# Create a new project, create an issue, create a new Scrum board.
# Create a new sprint, and set its start date to be at least 2 days later than the current date.
# End the sprint, and set its end date to any date before the start date.
# Observe that the sprint can be ended.
fields.summary: GreenHopper allows sprints to be ended even when the sprint end date is set before its start date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In JIRA we have disabled attachments using "Field configuration" for certain issue types lets say 'Bugs', if you create any issue for that issue type - 'Bugs' then JIRA does not show option to create attachments for that issue but if you open same issue in greenhopper's agile board, in issue detail view, it shown option to add/remove attachments which is disabled. Can you look into this issue and suggest what can be done to over come this problem.
fields.summary: Attachments are disabled in JIRA for some issue types but are shown in greenhopper's agile board

fields.description:
It would be good if a RapidBoard owner could mark a Version as Done so that it doesn't show up anymore. Or, you could trigger hiding the version based on its release status. There is no value on a planning board to show old versions.

Basically, I'm asking for the same ability you have to mark an epic as done for versions.
fields.summary: Mark a version as Done in the Plan Board
